headlines: Elon Musk terminates $44 billion deal to buy Twitter over breach of agreement
text: The world's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Friday said that he was terminating his $44 billion deal to acquire Twitter, alleging multiple breaches of the agreement. In a filing, Musk’s lawyers said Twitter had failed to respond to multiple requests for information on fake or spam accounts on the platform, which was fundamental to the company's performance.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Will pursue legal action to enforce merger: Twitter after Musk ends $44 billion deal
text: Twitter's Chairman Bret Taylor has said that the board plans to pursue legal action against Tesla CEO Elon Musk after he pulled out of the $44 billion deal. Taylor tweeted, "The Twitter Board is committed to closing the transaction on the price and terms agreed upon with Musk and plans to pursue legal action to enforce the merger agreement."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Huawei India sent ₹750 crore to parent firm in China to evade taxes: I-T Dept
text: The Income Tax Department has alleged that Huawei India transferred ₹750 crore to its parent company in China in the form of dividends to evade taxes. It further said that the company made these transfers in two years even as its revenues drastically fell in India. The I-T Department froze Huawei's bank accounts in February after raids at its premises.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: We have 9,000 employees: Vivo tells Delhi HC after ED freezes its bank accounts
text: Vivo India on Friday approached the Delhi High Court challenging the freezing of its bank accounts by the Enforcement Directorate in connection with a money laundering case. "We have 9,000 employees. There is a liability," said advocate Siddharth Luthra. The ED seized 119 bank accounts of various entities with ₹465 crore including Vivo India's fixed deposits of around ₹66 crore.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Mahindra's EV unit to raise $250 mn from UK's BII at $9.1 bn valuation
text: Mahindra and Mahindra and British International Investment (BII) will each invest up to $250 million in a new EV subsidiary of Mahindra at a valuation of $9.1 billion. BII's investment will result in a 2.75% to 4.76% stake in the business. Mahindra's shares rose to as much as 5.4% to a record high on Friday.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: End of season 1, what a cliffhanger: Twitter staff after Musk ends $44 bn deal
text: Reacting to Tesla CEO Elon Musk terminating the $44 billion Twitter deal, an employee at the social media company said, "I just don’t believe it’s actually over." Meanwhile, Amir Shevat, another Twitter employee wrote, "End of season one- what a cliffhanger." Other staff members shared memes, such as that of a rollercoaster ride and a baby screaming into a phone.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Adani Group to participate in 5G spectrum auction; to face Jio, Airtel: Report
text: The Adani Group has reportedly applied for participating in India’s first auction of 5G airwaves starting July 26. Three telecom operators- Reliance Jio, Bharti Airtel and Vodafone Idea have submitted their applications while Adani's participation is yet to be independently confirmed. A total of 72,097.85 MHz of spectrum worth at least ₹4.3 lakh crore will be put for auction.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Twitter fires 30% staff from its talent acquisition team amid deal with Musk
text: Months after announcing a hiring freeze, Twitter on Friday fired 30% of its talent acquisition team amid its $44 billion acquisition deal with Tesla CEO Elon Musk. A Twitter spokesperson confirmed these layoffs but did not share the exact number of affected employees. While these employees will receive severance packages, the company will "reprioritise" the remaining recruitment staff.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: What reasons did Elon Musk give for ending the $44 billion Twitter deal?
text: Apart from citing the lack of information regarding fake accounts, Tesla CEO Elon Musk's lawyers stated the insufficient data on financial condition, recent layoffs and hiring freeze by Twitter as reasons for ending the deal. The filing said Twitter fired two high-level employees and one-third of its talent acquisition team, breaching its obligation to preserve company's material components.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Need over ₹2,000 cr monthly, ED trying to disrupt business: Vivo on frozen accounts
text: Referring to the Enforcement Directorate freezing its bank accounts, Vivo told the Delhi High Court that it has to make monthly payments of around ₹2,826 crore towards statutory dues, salaries, rent and daily business operations. It added that ED has undertaken a "roving and fishing enquiry” against it and continues to make "various attempts to disrupt" its business.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Ola cuts jobs, delays appraisals citing business restructuring: Report
text: Ola is cutting jobs and has deferred the performance appraisal for employees for the year as it aims at "leaner and consolidated teams" to keep its "strong profitability intact", as per a report. Ola's HR reportedly told employees, "We're working on the restructuring of some of our businesses." It is reported that as many as 500 employees could be fired.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Theranos' Pak-born executive Ramesh Balwani found guilty of fraud in US
text: Ramesh 'Sunny' Balwani, the former President of Theranos and ex-boyfriend of its Founder Elizabeth Holmes, has been found guilty of fraud in US. The Pakistan-born executive was convicted on two counts of conspiracy and 10 counts of fraud. Balwani and Holmes were accused of exaggerating the abilities of Theranos' machines. The startup was valued at $9 billion before its collapse.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Who are the 5 Indian-Americans on Forbes list of richest self-made women in US?
text: Jayshree Ullal, CEO of Arista Networks, is the richest Indian-American on Forbes list of America's richest self-made women with $1.9 billion net worth. The list features Syntel Co-founder Neerja Sethi and Confluent Co-founder Neha Narkhede with $1 billion and $490 million fortune, respectively. PepsiCo's ex-CEO Indra Nooyi, who's worth $320 million, is the 4th richest Indian-American on the list.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Cut edible oil prices by ₹15 per litre immediately: Govt to edible oil associations
text: The government has directed leading edible oil associations to cut prices of edible oils by ₹15 per litre with immediate effect. The Centre has advised manufacturers and refiners to reduce the price of oils to distributors. "Whenever a reduction in price to distributors is made by...manufactures or refiners, the benefit should be passed on to the consumers," the government said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Bullet train project chief Satish Agnihotri fired over charges of corruption
text: The Railways has terminated the services of NHSRCL MD Satish Agnihotri, who was in charge of the government's bullet train project, following a Lokpal court order directing the CBI to probe corruption allegations against him. According to officials, there were several allegations against Agnihotri, including misuse of his official position and diverting funds illegally to a private company.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Planning to increase childcare benefits at my firms: Elon Musk
text: The world’s richest person Elon Musk on Friday said that he plans to "significantly" increase childcare benefits at his companies. Musk, who is now a father of nine children, while replying to a tweet seeking advice to those who don't have children "for cost reasons", said, "Kids are worth it...Also, Musk Foundation plans to donate directly to families."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: I am only as old as you think I am: Mahindra after Twitter user asks his age
text: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra on Saturday responded to a Twitter user who asked him his age. Mahindra wrote, "You could've found out via Google, so I suppose this is a philosophical question. In that spirit, my answer is that 'Age (like beauty) lies in the eyes of the beholder', so I'm only as old as you think I am."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: CBI files FIR against Chitra, ex-Mumbai Police chief for tapping phones of NSE officials
text: The CBI has filed an FIR against former Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey, former NSE head Ravi Narain and former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna for alleged phone tapping of NSE employees during 2009-2017. It said that Isec Securities Pvt Ltd, a company incorporated by Pandey in March 2001, conducted illegal surveillance of NSE employees on orders of NSE chiefs.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Former PayPal executive Jasmine Lee appointed Binance.US CFO
text: Binance.US, the US partner of world's largest crypto exchange Binance, appointed ex-PayPal Holdings executive Jasmine Lee as Chief Financial Officer (CFO) on Thursday. Lee has replaced interim CFO Eric Segal, who recently left the company after holding the role since October 2021. Jasmine had previously served as CFO and Chief Operating Officer for the Consumer Product Group at PayPal.
author: Bhawana Chaudhary

headlines: Banking, internet services disrupted in Canada as Rogers faces network outage
text: A major outage of Canadian telecom provider Rogers' mobile and internet networks on Friday disrupted banking services across the country. "Our technical teams are working hard to restore services as quickly as possible," the firm said on Twitter. This is the second major outage to hit one of the biggest telecom providers in Canada in 15 months.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: Volkswagen, partners to invest $20 billion to produce EV batteries
text: German automobile manufacturer Volkswagen said the company along with its partners will invest over $20 billion to produce electric vehicle (EV) batteries. This will result in the creation of 20,000 jobs and annual sales of above $20 billion by 2030, it added. The announcement was made at the groundbreaking ceremony of the company's first battery plant in Europe.
author: Mansi Agarwal

headlines: Decide on Vivo's request to operate bank accounts: Delhi HC to ED
text: The Delhi High Court on Friday asked the Enforcement Directorate (ED) to consider Vivo India's representation seeking permission to use its frozen bank accounts by July 13. The Chinese mobile manufacturer approached the court after ED raided 48 locations belonging to Vivo across the country. Representing the ED, advocate Zoheb Hossain opposed Vivo's plea, saying the petition is premature.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: TCS Q1 profit rises 5.21% y-o-y to ₹9,478 cr, revenue at ₹52,758 cr
text: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) has reported a 5.21% rise in its net profit at ₹9,478 crore for the April-June quarter of FY23, compared to ₹9,008 crore from the same quarter a year ago. The company's revenue rose by 16.2% year-on-year to ₹52,758 crore. TCS has also declared an interim dividend of ₹8 per share.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: Twitter got busted for spam accounts: Trump's son on Musk ending deal
text: Former US President Donald Trump's son Donald Trump Jr took to Twitter to comment on Elon Musk ending his $44-billion Twitter deal and said, "So basically Twitter has a huge amount of spam accounts...and has gotten busted for it!!!" "As I said weeks ago spam accounts are probably 50% not 5% of Twitter users," he added.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Tata Motors passenger vehicle range gets a price hike of 0.55%
text: Tata Motors has raised the prices of its passenger vehicle range with immediate effect in order to partially offset the impact of rising input costs. The price hike is fixed at 0.55% and will be levied across the models from today. The firm has already hiked the prices of its commercial vehicle range by 1.5%-2.5% from July.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: GoM to finalise report on levying 28% GST on online gaming next week
text: The Group of Ministers (GoM) will meet on Tuesday to finalise report on GST slab for online gaming, horse racing and casinos. Online games, where no betting or gambling is involved, are currently under 18% GST slab but GoM in May had proposed imposing 28% GST. GST Council had asked ministers to review and finalise the report by July 15.
author: Mansi Agarwal

headlines: Rohini Bhatia, wife of IndiGo Co-founder Rahul Bhatia, quits board
text: InterGlobe Aviation, the operator of IndiGo airline, said that Rohini Bhatia will resign from the board of directors of the company, with effect from July 11, 2022. Rohini is the wife of IndiGo Co-founder Rahul Bhatia and she is the Chairperson of the CSR committee of the company.  She had joined the board in 2019.
author: Bhawana Chaudhary

headlines: Vivo India sent ₹62,476 crore to China to avoid paying taxes: ED
text: The Indian arm of Chinese smartphone maker Vivo remitted 50% of its turnover to China to avoid paying taxes here, the Enforcement Directorate (ED) said. Around ₹62,476 crore of Vivo India's income was remitted to disclose huge losses in Indian incorporated companies, the agency said. Funds worth ₹465 crore in 119 banks linked to Vivo India entities have been seized.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Tata Projects, Power Grid executives arrested for bribery; ₹93 lakh cash seized
text: Senior executives of Power Grid Corporation of India and Tata Projects are among seven people arrested by CBI for alleged bribery to favour the private firm. Power Grid Executive Director BS Jha, Tata Projects Executive VP Deshraj Pathak and Assistant VP RN Singh have been arrested. Officials also recovered ₹93 lakh cash during a raid on Jha's Gurugram premises.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Gita Gopinath becomes the only woman to feature on the wall of former IMF Chief Economists
text: Gita Gopinath, the First Deputy Managing Director at the IMF, has become the first woman whose portrait was featured on the wall of former Chief Economists of the IMF. "Breaking the trend...I joined the wall of former Chief Economists of the IMF," tweeted Gopinath sharing two photos. She served as the Chief Economist of the Fund from 2019 to 2022.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: India curbs exports of wheat flour & related products from July 12
text: India has restricted the export of wheat flour (atta) and other related products like maida, semolina (rava) etc, making it mandatory for all such exporters to seek prior permission for the exports. A Directorate General of Foreign Trade notification said that the restrictions will come into effect from July 12. India had earlier banned wheat exports amid a heatwave.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Musk's Twitter deal in 'jeopardy', he has 'stopped funding discussions': Report
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk may walk away from the $44 billion agreement to buy Twitter as he doesn’t believe he has enough information on the number of fake accounts on Twitter, as per a report. According to The Washington Post report, the deal is "in serious jeopardy" and Musk has "stopped engaging in certain discussions around funding" for it.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Twitter says it removes over 1 million spam accounts daily, Musk reacts
text: Twitter removes over 1 million spam accounts daily, said executives on Thursday amid a report that Tesla CEO Elon Musk may drop the $44 billion deal over fake accounts' data. Reacting to this, Dogecoin's Co-founder Billy Markus remarked, "How many new real accounts does it have per day I wonder," to which Musk replied, "That is indeed the real question."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: 3 pvt banks allowed to provide services for defence procurement
text: The Centre has allowed three private-sector banks, HDFC Bank, ICICI Bank and Axis Bank, to provide financial services for overseas procurement by the Defence Ministry. Until now, only public-sector banks were allowed to offer these services. The banks may be allocated with LC business of ₹2,000 crore for one year, each on the capital and revenue side, the ministry said.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: NITI Aayog ex-CEO Kant to replace Piyush Goyal as G20 Sherpa: Reports
text: Former NITI Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant will replace Union Minister Piyush Goyal as the Sherpa for the G20 Summit, reports said. Goyal reportedly requested Kant to take up the role because of his busy schedule. With G20 Presidency coming to India in December, a full-time Sherpa will reportedly be needed to devote a lot of time to meetings across India.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: US exported 5 mn barrels of reserve oil to Asia, Europe last month amid record prices: Report
text: More than 5 million barrels of oil from the US Strategic Petroleum Reserve (SPR) were exported to Asia and Europe last month, as per reports. This comes despite the gasoline and diesel prices hitting record highs in the US. The latest exports follow three vessels that carried SPR crude to Europe in April helping replace Russian crude supplies.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Jhunjhunwala-backed Akasa Air gets DGCA license to start commercial operations
text: Billionaire Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed Akasa Air has received its Air Operator Certificate (AOC) from the DGCA, the aviation regulator said on Thursday. The airline will reportedly begin commercial flight operations later this month. Announcing the AOC's receipt, the airline said, "This is a significant milestone, enabling us to open our flights for sale."
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: IndiGo hikes pilot, crew salaries after reported mass leave on Air India hiring day
text: IndiGo has hiked the salaries of its pilots and cabin crew by a further 8%, days after reports said that the airline's staff took mass sick leave to attend Air India's recruitment drive. The airline will also reinstate layover and deadhead allowances for pilots and crew from July 31. Crew unavailability had caused delays for hundreds of IndiGo flights recently.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Sensex jumps 427 points to close at 54,178; Nifty ends above 16,000-mark
text: Indices rallied on Thursday with the BSE Sensex climbing 427 points (0.8%) to close over the 54,000-mark at 54,178 and the NSE Nifty50 closing above the 16,000-mark. Nifty50 rose 143 points or 0.89% and closed at 16,133. Titan Company, Tata Steel, L&T, ICICI Bank, IndusInd Bank, Kotak Bank and M&M were among the top gainers on Thursday.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Zomato responds after pic shows price difference between Zomato online & offline bills
text: Zomato has responded after a LinkedIn user made a comparison of Zomato online and offline food bills of the same order. Zomato responded to the user saying it has no control over the prices set by its partner restaurants. "That said, we have conveyed your feedback to the restaurant partner and have requested them to look into this," Zomato added.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Fintech firms, NBFCs funded by Chinese money generated ₹950-cr slush funds in India: ED
text: Several fintech companies and non-banking financial companies (NBFCs) backed by Chinese funds generated proceeds of crime worth nearly ₹950 crore by indulging in predatory lending activities and violating RBI guidelines in India, the ED said. The ED has mounted a crackdown on such companies who, it said, were "operating on the basis of instructions from Chinese, Hong Kong persons".
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: SoftBank's Rajeev Misra steps down from main roles to launch own fund
text: Rajeev Misra is stepping back from his main roles at SoftBank Group to launch his own venture fund, reports said. Misra will retain his role overseeing the first $100 billion Vision Fund but will cede his frontline role in managing the second Vision Fund. He's reportedly secured over $6 billion in backing for his fund, including from Middle East investors.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Rajesh Nambiar to no longer serve as Cognizant's digital business head
text: Cognizant has notified its shareholders that Rajesh Nambiar will no longer serve as the Executive Vice President and President of Digital Business and Technology, effective July 6. Nambiar will continue to serve as EVP, Chairman and Managing Director of Cognizant India. Cognizant has said that it will be simplifying its internal operating structure around practice areas and delivery operations.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: China's Xiaomi produces first smartphones in Vietnam
text: China's Xiaomi Corporation on Thursday said that it has produced its first batch of smartphones in Vietnam. The smartphones were produced in Thai Nguyen in a factory operated by Xiaomi's partner DBG Technology. The devices have been sent to a Vietnamese distributor, Xiaomi said, adding that it would soon export smartphones to other Southeast Asian markets, including Malaysia and Thailand.
author: Nidhi Sinha

headlines: Govt releases 2nd list of 23 beneficiaries under PLI scheme for drones
text: The government has released the second provisional list of 23 beneficiaries under the PLI Scheme of Drones and Drone Components. This list included Adani-Elbit, Garuda Aerospace, Throttle Aerospace Systems and Absolute Composites, among others. The combined annual sales turnover of the listed companies has increased from ₹88 crore in FY 2020-21 to ₹319 crore (unaudited) in FY 2021-22.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Tender for 200 4th-generation Vande Bharat trains by Aug: Report
text: Indian Railways is in the final stages of readying a tender to manufacture the fourth-generation Vande Bharat trains, a senior official told Moneycontrol. They said, "The bidding documents for the fourth generation of 200 Vande Bharat trains have been finalised...We're planning to float the tender by August." India plans to manufacture 400 Vande Bharat trains in the next three years.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Bengaluru residential unit sales jump 34% YoY in 1st quarter of 2022: Report
text: The Bengaluru residential real estate market saw its sales jump by 34% year-on-year (YoY) in the first quarter of 2022, according to global consultants Knight Frank's report. The residential real estate prices in Bengaluru also increased 7% YoY during this period, which is the highest in India. The rental levels increased by 4% in the city, as per the report.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: RBI forex measures to impact flow positively: Economic Affairs Secy
text: Economic Affairs Secretary Ajay Seth on Thursday said the measures announced by the RBI on Wednesday to enhance foreign exchange inflows will have a "positive" impact on flows. "In the overseas NDF (non-deliverable forwards) market, the rupee has appreciated," he stated. This comes after the rupee hit an all-time low of 79.37 against the US dollar on Tuesday.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Curbing global warming can cut Indian fossil fuel revenues: Report
text: In its efforts to limit global warming to 1.5 °C, India's fossil fuel revenues can drop around 65% of the 2019 levels by 2050, a report by the International Institute for Sustainable Development (IISD) said. Revenues from coal production can fall 15%, it added. India's fossil fuel revenues were $92.9 billion in 2019, accounting for 18% of total government revenues.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Global economic outlook has darkened, can't rule out recession: IMF
text: IMF MD Kristalina Georgieva has said the outlook for the global economy has "darkened significantly" since April and the possibility of a global recession next year can't be ruled out. "We're in very choppy waters," she added, citing a more universal spread of inflation and increased interest rate hikes. IMF would soon further downgrade its 2022 growth forecast, she added.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Federal Bank appoints MVS Murthy as its 1st Chief Marketing Officer
text: Federal Bank has appointed MVS Murthy as its first Chief Marketing Officer (CMO). Prior to being appointed at Federal Bank, Murthy was heading marketing, digital and corporate communication at TATA AMC. "We're happy to welcome MVS to the Federal family...I'm certain his vast experience will strengthen our brand positioning," said Federal Bank Chief Human Resources Officer (CHRO) Ajith Kumar KK.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Ethnic wear brand Libas looks to raise ₹150-200 cr for expansion
text: Ethnic wear brand Libas is looking to raise ₹150-200 crore through private equity for expansion of its offline presence. Sidhant Keshwani, CEO and Managing Director of Libas, said that they are in discussions with private equity firms and will announce a fund infusion soon. He further added that the company is targeting a revenue of ₹470-500 crore this fiscal.
author: Anisha Joneja

headlines: Map industrial activities for Gati Shakti scheme: FM to NITI Aayog
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Thursday asked the NITI Aayog to prepare a report mapping all industrial activities, including defence corridors and pharma hubs, so that they can be incorporated under the PM Gati Shakti scheme. "I find many of them still lying loose and unconnected," she stated, while adding, "Mapping it up will probably give a better idea."
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: CAs who helped Chinese nationals establish Vivo-linked firm under probe: Report
text: Indian agencies are now probing the local support that two Chinese nationals got in establishing a company which projected itself as a subsidiary of Vivo, The Economic Times reported citing sources. Two chartered accountants and a company secretary are under probe in the matter. Forged documents, certified by the three, were allegedly used to register Grand Prospect International Communication.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Man shares pics showing price difference between Zomato online & offline bills
text: A LinkedIn user has made a comparison of Zomato online and offline food bills of the same order. Rahul Kabra, a Performance Marketing Manager, shared the photos and wrote, "Cost escalation 34.76% per order at INR 178 = (690-512)/512." "Assuming Zomato brings visibility and more orders to the food service provider, should it charge such high price?" he added.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Domestic LPG cylinder rate increased by ₹50 from today
text: The price of a 14.2-kg domestic LPG cylinder has been increased by ₹50 with effect from Wednesday, July 6. A domestic LPG cylinder will now cost ₹1,053 in Delhi and ₹1,052.50 in Mumbai. The price of a 5-kg domestic cylinder was also increased by ₹18, however, the price of a 19-kg commercial cylinder was cut by ₹8.50.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Sri Lanka planning to stop printing notes as inflation nears 60%
text: Sri Lanka, which is facing one of the worst economic crises in years, plans to stop printing local currency as inflation nears 60%, the highest in Asia. The nation had been printing currency in order to pay salaries. PM Ranil Wickremesinghe told parliament that talks for a bailout from the IMF are complicated as the nation is bankrupt.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Dolo-650 manufacturer's Bengaluru office raided by Income Tax Department
text: The Income Tax Department on Wednesday conducted searches at the premises of Bengaluru-based pharmaceutical company Micro Labs Ltd, the manufacturers of Dolo-650 tablet, on charges of tax evasion, officials said. They added that the department is looking at financial documents, balance sheets and business distributor networks of the company as part of the searches.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Vivo Directors escape from India amid ED inquiry against the Chinese firm: Report
text: Vivo Directors Zhengshen Ou and Zhang Jie have escaped from India as Enforcement Directorate (ED) intensified inquiry into the money laundering case against the Chinese smartphone manufacturing company, said ANI quoting sources. ED on Tuesday conducted raids at 44 locations of Vivo and related firms. The raids were conducted under sections of the Prevention of Money Laundering Act.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Govt to earn ₹94,800 crore from windfall tax on domestic crude oil: Moody's
text: The government will generate close to $12 billion (₹94,800 crore) of additional revenue from windfall taxes on domestic crude oil production and fuel exports, as per an estimate by Moody's Investors Service. The tax increase will reduce profits of Reliance Industries and ONGC, it added. Last week, the government imposed a ₹23,230 per tonne charge on domestically produced crude oil.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Voyager Digital files for bankruptcy, 2nd crypto firm to do so in days
text: Cryptocurrency lender Voyager Digital has filed for Chapter 11 of the US Bankruptcy Code, which allows reorganisation of debts. In its filing, the US-headquartered firm estimated it had over 10,000 creditors, $1-$10 billion in assets and liabilities worth the same value. Last week, it issued a default notice to crypto hedge fund Three Arrows Capital, which later filed for bankruptcy.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: JP Morgan cuts price target for Tesla as deliveries drop for 1st time in 2 yrs
text: JP Morgan analysts cut their price target for Tesla shares by $10 to $385 as it reported fall in deliveries for the first time in two years. The analysts said Tesla's production and financial results could be affected by execution issues at its new factories in Texas and Berlin. Recently, CEO Elon Musk described both factories as "gigantic money furnaces".
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Fine on TCS in intellectual property case in US halved to $140 mn
text: The punitive damages levied on Tata Consultancy Services in an intellectual property lawsuit in the US have been halved to $140 million, it said Monday. As per the lawsuit filed by Epic Systems in 2014, TCS stole its trade secrets to develop its own product. TCS, found guilty in 2016, is expected to pay another $140 million in compensatory damages.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Business is currently firm for our chip industry: Taiwan amid slowdown
text: Taiwan's Economy Minister Wang Mei-hua said on Wednesday that the business for the country's semiconductor industry is currently "firm". The order books of Taiwan's chip firms "are still very full", she added. Her assurance came after American chip manufacturer Micron Technology said last week that the chip market had "weakened considerably in a very short period of time".
author: Mansi Agarwal

headlines: RBI to release Code of Conduct for digital lending by July-end: Report
text: The Reserve Bank of India will release the Code of Conduct for digital lending by the end of this month, ET Now reported citing sources. The guidelines will be applicable to all regulated entities including NBFCs and banks. Consumer consent will become mandatory for using data collected from users, the report added.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: French engine maker Safran to set up MRO facility in Hyderabad
text: French engine maker Safran will set up a maintenance, repair and overhaul (MRO) facility in Hyderabad with investment of $150 million. The facility will be for LEAP-1A and LEAP-1B engines being used in aircraft by both Indian and foreign commercial airlines. The defence ministry said the MRO facility will be able to overhaul more than 250 engines per year initially.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Samsung Electronics forecasts highest Q2 operating profit since 2018
text: Samsung Electronics posted its preliminary earnings report for the second quarter on Thursday, forecasting highest Q2 operating profit since 2018. The South Korea-based company's profit in Q2 rose to around $10.73 billion, up from around $9.63 billion in the same quarter last year, as per estimates. Its sales rose to around $59.14 billion, the report estimated.
author: Mansi Agarwal

headlines: ED summons crypto exchanges, seeks info under FEMA: Reports
text: Enforcement Directorate (ED), which is probing alleged instances of foreign exchange violations, has summoned CoinSwitch Kuber, CoinDCX and other crypto exchanges in the case, as per reports. The agency is reportedly seeking details like transaction history under Foreign Exchange Management Act (FEMA). "ED is examining every detail on offshore transactions," an official told The Economic Times.
author: Mansi Agarwal

headlines: I hope Tesla doesn't need to enter mining industry: Elon Musk
text: Elon Musk said he hopes that Tesla does not need to enter the mining industry owing to its limitations. Speaking on the Getting Stoned podcast, Musk took the example of lithium and said that to make lithium-ion batteries, the refining process to achieve lithium's purity can be a chokepoint. Tesla would rather focus its talent on sustainability transition, Musk added.
author: Anisha Joneja

headlines: Food Ministry calls meeting of edible oil firms for reduction in prices
text: The Food Ministry has called a meeting on Wednesday with edible oil companies to discuss reduction in the MRPs of cooking oils, Food Secretary Sudhanshu Pandey said. He added, "We'll tell them to pass on the benefits of reduction in global prices...to consumers." In the last one month, global prices have reportedly fallen $300-$450 per tonnes of different edible oils.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Tata Motors' disqualification from BEST's bid upheld by Bombay HC
text: The Bombay HC upheld the Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport Undertaking's (BEST Undertaking) decision to disqualify Tata Motors from a tender bid for supplying 1,400 e-buses. It said BEST was right to disqualify Tata Motors for being "technically unresponsive". However, it also held the winning bidder, Evey Trans, as "non-responsive" and directed BEST to call for fresh bids, if required.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Oil prices drop to 12-week low amid recession, COVID-19 fears
text: Oil prices on Wednesday dropped to a 12-week low amid fears of a possible global recession and demand cut in China amid new COVID-19 lockdowns. While Brent futures for September delivery fell 2.9% to $99.78 a barrel, US West Texas Intermediate (WTI) crude fell 3.2% to $96.31. This comes a day after Brent fell 9% and WTI fell 8%.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: City Union Bank to raise up to ₹500 crore via QIP route
text: City Union Bank on Wednesday announced it is planning to raise up to ₹500 crore through the qualified institutional placement (QIP) route. The private lender added that it has called an annual general meeting (AGM) on August 18 to seek approval for the fund-raising proposal. Last year also it obtained shareholders' approval but did not utilise the same, it added.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Centre releases revenue deficit grant of ₹7,183 crore to 14 states
text: The Finance Ministry on Wednesday released the fourth instalment of Post Devolution Revenue Deficit (PDRD) Grant of ₹7,183.42 crore to 14 states for the current fiscal. With this, the total amount of PDRD grants released to the states in 2022-23 stands at ₹28,733.67 crore. The states will get a total revenue deficit grant of ₹86,201 crore in FY23.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Reduce prices by up to ₹10 within a week: Govt to edible oil firms
text: The government has directed edible oil manufacturers to cut the MRP of imported cooking oils by up to ₹10 per litre within a week. "Global prices have declined 10% in last one week...This should be passed on to consumers," the government said. It also asked the companies to maintain a uniform MRP of the same brand of oil throughout India.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: RBI announces steps to boost forex inflows amid falling rupee
text: The RBI on Wednesday announced various measures to enhance foreign exchange inflows amid the rupee losing about 6% against the US dollar so far this year. The measures include allowing overseas investors to buy short-term corporate debt and purchase more government securities under the fully accessible route. India's forex reserves have fallen over $40 billion in the last nine months.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: India's coal production rises 32.57% year-on-year in June 2022
text: The Ministry of Coal on Wednesday said that the coal production has risen by 32.57% to 67.59 million tonnes (MT) in June 2022 from 50.98 MT in June 2021. Likewise, coal-based power generation registered a growth of 26.58% in June 2022 as compared to June 2021. The overall power generation in June 2022 was 17.73% higher year-on-year, it added.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Alstom wins Bhopal, Indore metro rail project order worth ₹3,200 cr
text: Madhya Pradesh Metro Rail Corporation Limited (MPMRCL) has awarded France-based Alstom an order worth ₹3,200 crore to deliver 156 Movia metro cars for Bhopal and Indore metro rail projects. The contract also includes comprehensive maintenance and installation of latest generation of Communications Based Train Control (CBTC) signalling system. The trains will be built at Alstom's Gujarat facility.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Fuel, electricity should be brought under GST ambit: CII President
text: The Confederation of Indian Industry's (CII) President and Bajaj Finserv Chairman Sanjiv Bajaj on Tuesday told PTI that items like electricity and fuel should be brought under the GST ambit. "[It]  will further help simplify, cut costs...[and] make industry more competitive," he stated. He added that the number of tax slabs under the GST should be brought down to three.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: HDFC-HDFC Bank merger gets 'no objection' letter from RBI
text: HDFC Bank on Monday said it has received the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) approval for its potential merger with its parent company HDFC. "The RBI has accorded its 'no objection' for the scheme...subject to certain conditions," it stated. The merger, which received approval from BSE and NSE last week, remains subject to approvals from the CCI and the NCLT.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Reliance Retail signs long-term deal to bring Gap to India
text: Reliance Retail on Wednesday said it has signed a long-term deal with Gap Inc to sell the US clothing retailer's brands locally. Under the partnership, Reliance will sell Gap merchandise through a mix of exclusive brand stores, multi-brand outlets and e-commerce platforms. With this deal, the company has become the official retailer for Gap across all channels in India.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Rupee hits fresh record low as it closes at 79.36 against US dollar
text: The Indian rupee declined by 41 paise to close at 79.36 on Tuesday, marking a fresh lifetime low for the currency. Earlier today, the rupee touched a record low of 79.15 amid concerns of a wider current account deficit. The concerns come after India's trade deficit widened to a record $25.63 billion in June from $9.61 billion a year ago.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: ED raids over 40 locations of Vivo, related firms in money laundering probe
text: The Enforcement Directorate on Tuesday conducted raids at Chinese smartphone manufacturing company Vivo and related firms, officials said. The raids were carried out at 44 locations across the country under sections of the Prevention of Money Laundering Act. Earlier in May, local units of ZTE Corporation and Vivo were investigated for alleged financial irregularities.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: India's services sector growth hits 11-year high in June
text: India's services sector grew at the fastest pace in over 11 years in June amid strong demand. The S&P Global India Services Purchasing Managers' Index rose to 59.2 in June from 58.9 in May, its highest since April 2011. As per companies, the growth stemmed from ongoing improvements in demand following the retreat of COVID-19 restrictions and capacity expansion.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Rupee hits all-time low of 79.15 against US dollar
text: The rupee touched a new record low of 79.15 against the US dollar during Tuesday's trade. Last week, it touched a record low of 79.12 and closed at 78.95 on Monday. A government official on Monday said that India is trying to "address volatility" in the Indian rupee, which has plunged 6% against the dollar this year.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Vauld suspends trading, deposits & withdrawals citing 'financial difficulties'
text: Singapore-based cryptocurrency exchange Vauld has suspended all trading, withdrawals, and deposits on its platform. CEO Darshan Bathija said that the decision has been taken due to "volatile market conditions" and "financial difficulties" that its business partners are facing and is impacting them too. Founded in 2018, while Vauld is based in Singapore, most of its workforce is based in India.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Crypto exchanges' trading volume falls by 70% in 3 days as TDS rule takes effect
text: Trading volumes on Indian cryptocurrency exchanges declined by at least 70% in three days after the new rule requiring 1% tax deduction at source on every transaction came into effect on July 1. Trading volumes on WazirX were down the most at 82%, as per data from Crebaco. Meanwhile, ZebPay and CoinDCX saw a decline of 76% and 70%, respectively.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Tata Power signs MoU with Tamil Nadu for ₹3,000 cr solar plant
text: Tata Power has signed an MoU with the Tamil Nadu government to invest ₹3,000 crore for setting up a greenfield 4GW Cell and 4GW module solar manufacturing plant in Tamil Nadu. The facility will create over 2,000 employment opportunities with the majority being women employees. The investment will be made over a period of 16 months.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Goenka shares pic with 'lookalike' Maharashtra CM, says 'My security can be a nuisance'
text: RPG Enterprises' Chairman Harsh Goenka on Sunday tweeted a photo of himself with Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde while referring to the similarities in their appearance. Goenka tweeted, "To those who come to meet me, sorry for any [inconvenience]. I know my Z+ security can be a nuisance. Look forward to your support. Jai Maharashtra!"
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Trell served legal notice over unpaid dues of ₹47 lakh
text: Trell has been served a legal notice by Creatify Web Services, which runs influencer management agency Idiotic Media, for unpaid dues amounting to ₹47 lakh. It has also demanded ₹5 lakh from Trell over mental agony and harassment. Earlier, it was reported that Trell hasn't paid some influencers for the last six to seven months.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Employment hits 12-month-low in June as unemployment rate rises to 7.8%: CMIE
text: India's overall unemployment rate rose to 7.8% in the month of June, according to data from the Centre for Monitoring Indian Economy (CMIE). The fall in employment was led by unemployment in rural areas, which jumped from 6.62% in May to 8.03% in June. India saw its lowest employment in June in the last 12 months, the CMIE said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: India to drop windfall tax if oil prices fall $40 a barrel: Revenue Secretary
text: India will withdraw its windfall tax for oil producers and refiners only if global prices of crude oil fall to $40 a barrel from present levels, said Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj. Last week, the Centre imposed a ₹23,230 per tonne additional tax on domestically produced crude oil to take away windfall gains accruing to producers from high international oil prices.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: South Korea's inflation touches 24-year high in June
text: South Korea's inflation rate reached a nearly 24-year high in June amid soaring energy and food prices. The Consumer Price Index rose 6% in June over a year earlier, the highest level since November 1998 during the Asian financial crisis. The CPI rose in almost every sector, with petrochemicals jumping 39.6% and the restaurants sector surging 8%.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Chinese real estate firms take watermelons as down payment amid market slump
text: Amid a property market slump, Chinese real estate companies have started accepting down payments for houses in watermelon, garlic and other agricultural produce. A developer was reportedly allowing buyers to buy homes using watermelon at a rate of 20 yuan per kilogram. As per analysts, property sales in China dropped by 25% from January to June due to COVID-19 restrictions.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Euro slumps to 20-year-low against US dollar amid fear of recession
text: The euro slumped to a 20-year-low against the US dollar on Tuesday, after the latest surge in European gas prices added to a growing fear of recession in the region. The currency fell as much as 0.8% to its weakest level since December 2002. The euro has dropped more than 8% against the US dollar this year amid record inflation.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Iran cuts price of its crude oil in China amid competition with Russia: Report
text: Iran has discounted its crude oil price in China amid competition with Russia, as per a report. Russian exports to China surged to a record level in May, making it China's biggest supplier of oil and displacing Saudi Arabia from that position. Notably, China's official data only lists three months of imports from Iran since the end of 2020.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: India needs fewer GST slabs, but 28% rate will remain: Revenue Secretary
text: Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj said the government aims to simplify the GST by consolidating the lower tax slabs. "India needs fewer slabs. 28% slab will remain, but whether 5%, 12%, and 18% rates can be simplified is yet to be seen," he explained. The government is aiming for stability in GST in the next one or two years, Bajaj added.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: ITC shares hit 52-week high, surge nearly 34% in a year
text: Shares of ITC hit a fresh 52-week high on Monday to close at ₹291.80 apiece, up by nearly 2% from its previous close of ₹284. The stock also hit an intraday high of ₹293.30 on the BSE on Monday. While the stock closed at ₹218 on December 31, its shares have gained nearly 34% this year.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: NFT sales hit 12-month low in June after cryptocurrency crash
text: Sales of non-fungible tokens (NFTs) reached a 12-month low in June following a downturn in the cryptocurrency market. The average number of daily sales of NFTs fell to around 19,000 in June in comparison to its peak between August and November last year when NFT sales were frequently topping more than 2,00,000 per day.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: RBI fines Kotak Mahindra Bank ₹1.05 cr, IndusInd Bank ₹1 cr for non-compliance
text: The RBI has imposed a monetary penalty of ₹1.05 crore on Kotak Mahindra Bank for not following its directions on customer protection and loans and advances. The bank also failed to credit eligible amount to Depositor Education and Awareness Fund within the prescribed period. Further, IndusInd Bank has been fined ₹1 crore for its failure to adhere to KYC rules.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: 1st look of Jhunjhunwala-backed Akasa Air's crew uniform with sneakers, jackets released
text: Billionaire and ace investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed Akasa Air has released the first look of its crew uniform comprising orange jackets, black trousers and sneakers. The airline said it's the first to introduce such a uniform for the in-flight crew. The uniforms are made using recycled polyester fabric made from pet bottle plastics salvaged from marine waste, said Akasa.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: IndiGo crew took mass leave on Air India recruitment day causing flight delays: Reports
text: A significant number of cabin crew members of IndiGo had taken sick leave on Saturday when Air India conducted its recruitment drive, reports said on Sunday. PTI reported that the staffers took leave from work and went for the recruitment drive. This came after DGCA took note of the massive delays in IndiGo flights reported on Saturday.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: AstraZeneca to buy biotech firm TeneoTwo for up to $1.27 bn
text: Drugmaker AstraZeneca has signed an agreement to acquire biotechnology firm TeneoTwo for up to $1.27 billion. AstraZeneca plans to acquire all outstanding equity of TeneoTwo for an upfront payment of $100 million, with additional milestone-related payments of up to $1.17 billion. The transaction may close in the third quarter of this year.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: IKEA to reopen for online fire sale in Russia before market exit
text: IKEA's Russian customers will be allowed to purchase goods in an online-only fire sale a final time before the company winds down its operations in Russia. "From July 5 for a few weeks you can buy IKEA goods only on ikea.ru. Goods will be on sale for as long as they are in stock," IKEA said.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: HDFC-HDFC Bank merger receives go-ahead from NSE and BSE
text: HDFC Bank and parent HDFC on Sunday said that they have received "no adverse observations" from BSE and "no objection" from the National Stock Exchange (NSE) for their merger. However, in separate regulatory filings, they noted that the proposed HDFC-HDFC Bank merger still requires approvals from the RBI, CCI and NCLT. The merger was announced in April this year.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: JSW Steel to invest ₹10,000cr to reduce carbon footprint: Chairman
text: JSW Steel has earmarked ₹10,000 crore for investments to reduce its carbon footprint, JSW Group Chairman Sajjan Jindal said. He added that this will be done by increasing the use of renewable energy to replace thermal power and reduce the firm's fuel rate, among others. "We have committed to reducing our CO2 emissions intensity...by 42% by 2030," Jindal said.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Chip business turnover expected to be around $3.5bn: Vedanta Group
text: Vedanta Group's global MD of display and semiconductor business Akarsh Hebbar said the firm expects its semiconductor business turnover to be in the range of $3 to $3.5 billion. "This will be from both display and semiconductor combined...We expect $1 billion to come from exports," he added. The firm has earmarked investments of up to $20 billion for the business.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: FPIs withdraw ₹50,203 crore in June, highest net outflow in 2 years
text: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) withdrew a net sum of ₹50,203 crore from equities in June, data showed. This is the highest net outflow since March 2020, when they pulled out ₹61,973 crore. Overall, in the first six months of 2022, FPIs pulled out around ₹2.2 lakh crore from domestic equities, which is the highest-ever net withdrawal by them.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Govt increases export duty on petrol by ₹6 per litre, diesel by ₹13 per litre
text: The government on Friday increased the export duty on petrol, diesel, and aviation turbine fuel (ATF). Export duty on petrol has been raised by ₹6 per litre and ₹13 per litre on diesel. Export duty on ATF has been upped by ₹6 per litre. Increase in export duty on the various fuels will not increase domestic fuel prices.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Govt hikes import tax on gold from 7.5% to 12.5% amid declining rupee
text: The central government has raised the basic import tax on gold to 12.5% from 7.5% as the Indian rupee declined to a record low. India, the world's second-biggest consumer of gold, imported gold worth $6.03 billion in May, a nine-fold rise from a year earlier. Notably, last year the Centre had cut the tax to 7.5% in the Budget.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Crypto hedge fund Three Arrows files for Chapter 15 bankruptcy in US
text: Cryptocurrency hedge fund Three Arrows Capital (3AC) has filed for Chapter 15 of the US Bankruptcy Code, which allows foreign debtors to shield US assets. Singapore-based 3AC is one of the highest-profile investors hit by the sharp sell-off in cryptocurrency markets. Notably, the company had reportedly managed an estimated $10 billion in assets as recently as March.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Twitter CEO takes coffee orders from staff during visit to UK office, pics surface
text: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal visited the company's office in the United Kingdom last week for a series of events. Employees took to Twitter to share photos of Agrawal taking coffee orders while another top Twitter executive, CFO Ned Segal served cookies along with it to the staff. The Managing Director of Twitter UK could also be seen with Agrawal.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Bill Gates shares his 48-year-old résumé, says 'I'm sure yours looks a lot better'
text: World's fourth-richest person Bill Gates shared his résumé from 1974 on LinkedIn and wrote, "Whether you're a recent grad or a college dropout, I'm sure your résumé looks a lot better than mine did 48 years ago." The résumé, which the Microsoft Co-founder wrote during his first year at Harvard, lists his objective as a "systems analyst or systems programmer".
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: How much wealth have the world's richest people lost in the last 6 months?
text: World's 500 richest people lost $1.4 trillion in the first half of 2022, marking the steepest six-month drop ever for the global billionaire group, Bloomberg reported. While the world's richest person Elon Musk lost $61.8 billion, Jeff Bezos saw his wealth decline by $62.7 billion. Mark Zuckerberg's net worth has plunged by more than half to $60 billion in 2022.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: What's included & what's not as 1% TDS on virtual digital assets comes into effect?
text: The rules governing the imposition of 1% TDS on the transfer of virtual digital assets (VDAs) of more than ₹10,000 has come into effect from today. All cryptocurrencies and NFTs, except tangible asset-backed NFTs, will be subject to TDS deduction. Further, the government has clarified that gift cards or vouchers, mileage points, reward points, and website subscriptions are not VDAs.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Income Tax portal facing issues, Infosys has observed some irregular traffic: Govt
text: The government on Saturday said it has noticed that taxpayers are facing issues in accessing the Income Tax e-filing portal. "As informed by Infosys, they have observed some irregular traffic on the portal for which proactive measures are being taken," the Income Tax Department wrote on Twitter. The tax e-filing portal built by Infosys was launched on June 7, 2021.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: China's Great Wall Motors drops $1 bn India entry plan, reportedly fires staff
text: Chinese carmaker Great Wall Motors has abandoned its $1-billion plan to enter the Indian market. The development comes after the company failed to get the government's approval to acquire General Motors' Talegaon plant near Pune after waiting for two and a half years. The company has shut its India office and terminated its team of 8-10 employees, as per reports.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Tesla deliveries drop by 18% in Q2 due to COVID-19 shutdown in China
text: Due to China's COVID-19-related shutdown and its subsequent disruption of the company's production and supply chain, Tesla delivered 17.9% fewer electric vehicles in the second quarter than the previous quarter. Tesla said while June 2022 was the highest vehicle production month in the company's history, the preceding quarter ended a nearly two-year-long run of record quarterly deliveries.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Rupee relatively better placed than other global currencies against US dollar: FM
text: Amid a declining rupee against the US dollar, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that the Indian currency is relatively better placed than other global currencies against the US dollar. Sitharaman said that she is "watchful and mindful" of the impact of the falling rupee and added, "We aren't alone in this world...developments happening everywhere will have an impact on us."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: IndiGo flights hit by delays across India over staff shortage, DGCA seeks clarification
text: IndiGo flight operations have been hit with massive delays across India due to the non-availability of crew members, reports said on Sunday. Aviation regulator DGCA has taken cognisance of the issue and sought a clarification/explanation from the airline, ANI reported citing DGCA officials. As many as 900 IndiGo flights have been affected due to staff shortage, ET Now reported.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: If you disagree, close your account: UK bank to customers upset by pronoun badges
text: UK-based Halifax has said that customers objecting to the bank's decision to allow employees to display their pronouns on name badges can close their accounts. The controversy started after Halifax tweeted a picture of a name badge saying "Gemma (she/her/hers)", along with the caption, "Pronouns matter". Halifax said, "If you disagree with our values, you're welcome to close your account."
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Have utmost respect for religious beliefs: Samsung Pak after being accused of blasphemy
text: Samsung's Pakistan unit issued a statement as violent protests erupted in a Karachi mall after the multinational company was accused of blasphemy by a mob. Samsung said it "has utmost respect for all religious sentiments", adding that it has initiated a probe into the matter. Reportedly, over 20 Samsung employees were detained over this.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Biden asks oil firms to lower prices amid 'war & global peril', Bezos responds
text: The world's second-richest person Jeff Bezos responded to a tweet by US President Joe Biden, who asked oil companies to lower their prices amid "war and global peril". Bezos wrote, "Ouch. Inflation is far too important a problem for the White House to keep making statements like this. It's either straight ahead misdirection or a...misunderstanding of basic market dynamics."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Bezos' superyacht stuck as firm decides against dismantling bridge to let it sail
text: Jeff Bezos' $500 million superyacht is stuck after the Dutch firm building it decided against dismantling a bridge following public backlash, Dutch news outlet Trouw reported. Oceanco had earlier said it needed to have the bridge taken apart in order to allow the superyacht to sail. Trouw used freedom of information legislation to find out more about the firm's plan.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: RIL shares fall by 5%, its biggest decline in 18 months after govt raises fuel excise duty
text: After the Centre announced an increase in taxes on the export of petrol, diesel, and aviation turbine fuel (ATF), shares of Reliance Industries Ltd (RIL), ONGC and Oil India witnessed a decline. While RIL shares plunged over 5% in its biggest decline in about 18 months, shares of ONGC dropped by 10% during intraday trade on Friday.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: HDFC yet to recover funds after sending ₹1,000 cr to some accounts due to glitch: Report
text: HDFC Bank is still attempting to recover funds from some customers in Tamil Nadu after it mistakenly transferred ₹1,000 crore into their accounts in May, BQ Prime reported. About ₹35-40 crore continues to remain with customers, the report said. The transfer of funds was caused due to a technical glitch, following which HDFC briefly froze many of these bank accounts.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: M-cap of 3 of top 10 most valued firms decline by ₹73,630 crore in past week
text: The market valuation of three of the 10 most valued domestic firms declined by ₹73,630.56 crore in past week. While Reliance Industries took the biggest hit and saw its valuation dipping by ₹62,100.95 crore to reach ₹16,29,684.50 crore. It was followed by ICICI Bank and HUL whose valuation dropped by ₹6,654.2 crore and ₹4,875.41 crore, respectively.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Former DE Shaw partner fired for sexual misconduct wins record $52 million in US
text: A former partner at American hedge fund DE Shaw, who was fired at the start of the #MeToo movement in 2018, has been awarded record $52 million by an arbitration panel in the US. Daniel Michalow had filed a defamation complaint against DE Shaw seeking $600 million in damages. The panel also found that Michalow "did not commit sexual misconduct".
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Punjab National Bank hikes FD interest rates on selected tenors from July 4
text: Punjab National Bank has increased interest rates on fixed deposits below ₹2 crore. Effective from July 4, it has increased rates on deposits with a maturity of 1-2 years and up to 3 years by 10 to 20 basis points. Deposits of 1-2 years will fetch a 5.30% interest rate, up by 10 basis points from 5.20%.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Factually untrue: Edelweiss on report of firm putting its Mutual Fund business for sale
text: Edelweiss has issued a clarification after a report claimed that the company has put its Mutual Fund business for sale. In a statement, Edelweiss said, "We strongly...deny the report...the news is factually untrue and purely speculative and motivated by vested interests." It further called its MF business a "strong franchisee" and shared its growth numbers.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: 91-yr-old billionaire Rupert Murdoch's 4th wife Jerry files for divorce after 6 yrs
text: Model Jerry Hall has filed for divorce from media tycoon Rupert Murdoch after six years of marriage. Hall has cited "irreconcilable differences" between her and Murdoch, and sought unspecified spousal support from the 91-year-old billionaire. This will be the fourth divorce for Murdoch. The 66-year-old model was previously the long-term partner of The Rolling Stones' lead vocalist Mick Jagger.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: ₹1.5 lakh cr wiped off Reliance's market value as govt raises export duty on fuel
text: Nearly ₹1.5 lakh crore has been wiped out from the market capitalisation of Reliance Industries after its stock declined as much as 8.7% on Friday, marking its biggest intraday drop since November 2, 2020. The shares fell after the Centre raised export duty on fuel. ONGC shares also plunged by 12.3% on Friday, its biggest slide since March 23, 2020.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: 59,000 Tesla cars have faulty emergency call system: German authority
text: Germany's road traffic agency said it is recalling Tesla models Y and 3 over a software glitch that affects 59,129 Tesla vehicles globally. As per the agency, the glitch causes breakdown of the eCall, which is designed to automatically contact emergency responders in the event of serious accidents. This comes as Tesla reported an 18% decline in deliveries in Q2.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Hero MotoCorp gets permit to use 'Hero' trademark for its EVs
text: A Delhi High Court-appointed arbitration panel has permitted Hero MotoCorp to manufacture and sell EVs under the trademark 'Hero'. It dismissed the application filed by Hero Electric for an interim injunction against Hero MotoCorp using the 'Hero' brand for EVs. The tribunal emphasised our ₹7,000-crore expenses on the brand building of Hero in the past 10 years, Hero MotoCorp said.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Banking frauds of over ₹100 crore decline by over 50% in FY22: Data
text: The number of banking sector frauds worth over ₹100 crore declined to 118 in FY22 from 265 in FY21, official data showed. As per data, banks reported cases worth ₹41,000 crore in FY22 compared to ₹1.05 lakh-crore last year. This comes as RBI carried out a study on the implementation of Early Warning System framework in select banks in 2021-22.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: 4, including 3 ONGC employees, die after helicopter crashes in Arabian Sea
text: Four people have been confirmed dead after an ONGC helicopter carrying nine persons made an emergency landing in the Arabian Sea on Tuesday. While three of them were ONGC employees, the fourth person was an employee of the contractor hired by ONGC. The chopper was attempting to land at a rig when it fell into the sea, as per reports.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Rupee hits fresh record low of 79.12 against US dollar
text: Amid a strengthening dollar and rising global crude oil prices, the Indian rupee hit a fresh record low of 79.12 against the US dollar after the currency opened at 78.98 in Friday's session. The rupee had touched the 79-mark for the first time ever after it closed at a record low of 79.03 against the US dollar on Wednesday.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: There are people at Meta who shouldn't be here: Zuckerberg on hiring cuts
text: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg while informing his employees about the hiring cuts at the company this year, remarked, "There are probably a bunch of people at the company who shouldn't be here." Speaking about "turning up the heat" on performance, "I think some of you might decide that this place isn't for you, and that self-selection is okay with me."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Tesla staff face shortage of desks, weak Wi-Fi as they return to US office: Report
text: Tesla employees faced several problems as they returned to the company's Fremont, California, facility this month, The Information reported. The problems included a lack of parking spaces, a shortage of desks, and weak Wi-Fi, the report said. Earlier, Tesla CEO Elon Musk said employees must spend a minimum of 40 hours per week in the office or else "depart Tesla".
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: China's SenseTime co-founder loses $2.3 bn after firm's shares fall 51%
text: China-based SenseTime Co-founder Tang Xiao'ou's net worth plunged by $2.3 billion after its shares fell by up to 51% today. Post the loss, Tang fell out of the list of the world's 500 richest people, Bloomberg reported. The shares fell after the lock-up period on a portion of shares held by cornerstone investors and stakeholders expired a day earlier.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Meta to reduce hiring, Zuckerberg says 'This may be one of the worst downturns'
text: CEO Mark Zuckerberg told Meta employees that it will reduce hiring engineers by at least 30% this year. He added, "This might be one of the worst downturns...we've seen in recent history". Meanwhile, Chief Product Officer Chris Cox in an internal memo to the staff also wrote, "I have to underscore that we're in serious times here and...headwinds are fierce."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Hyundai, Kia raided over illegal defeat devices in diesel vehicles in Germany
text: German authorities have raided Hyundai and Kia over allegations that they put over 210,000 diesel vehicles with suspected illegal defeat devices onto the road. Defeat devices are mechanisms or software that can change vehicle emissions levels. In 2015, Volkswagen admitted to using software to cheat US emissions tests on some diesel engines.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Swiggy to buy back ESOPs worth $23 million to incentivise 900 employees
text: Swiggy will be buying back shares worth $23 million issued under its employee stock option programme (ESOP) from about 900 employees in a bid to incentivise them. Swiggy also rolled out a new programme, Build Your Own Dollar (BYOD), wherein all permanent employees can invest in ESOPs. "Rewarding employees by creating wealth opportunities is one of our priorities," said Swiggy.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: New labour laws allow for 4-day work week, increased PF contribution
text: Centre seeks to implement new labour laws from July 1, but several states are yet to ratify regulations, which is a must before implementation. Under the new laws, companies can increase timings to 12 hours with three weekly offs. The basic salary will be at least 50% of gross monthly salary which will increase PF contribution but reduce in-hand salary.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Which are the world's most expensive cities for foreign workers?
text: Hong Kong has topped the list of the most expensive cities for international employees released by American asset management firm Mercer in its 2022 Cost of Living global report. Hong Kong is followed by four Swiss cities namely Zurich, Geneva, Basel and Bern. Israel's Tel Aviv has been ranked sixth most expensive city for foreign workers.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Walgreens abandons plan to sell UK's largest pharmacy chain Boots
text: Walgreens is abandoning the sale of Boots, Britain's largest drugstore chain, citing "unexpected and dramatic change" in the global financial markets. The company said that no third party was able to make an adequate offer. Notably, Walgreens had been in talks with a consortium between Reliance Industries and Apollo Global Management over the sale of Boots for over $6.1 billion.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Rupee breaches 79 per US dollar mark for the first time ever
text: The Indian rupee ended on Wednesday at a new record low, marking the sixth straight session of all-time weak levels. PTI reported that it fell 19 paise to close at all-time low of 79.04, provisionally, against US dollar. On Tuesday, the rupee closed at an all-time low of 78.83 against the US dollar.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: India deregulates sale of domestically produced crude oil
text: The Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs has approved deregulation of the sale of domestically produced crude oil. It will be implemented from October 2022. Exploration and Production companies are free to sell crude oil from their fields in Indian market and exports shall continue to be prohibited. "This decision will further spur economic activities," a press release stated.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: EY fined record $100 million for staff cheating on accountant exams in US
text: Big Four accounting firm Ernst & Young (EY) has been fined a record $100 million by US Securities and Exchange Commission after some of its auditors cheated on required ethics exams. Further, EY failed to report the issue during the investigation of potential cheating at the firm. This is the largest-ever penalty imposed by the SEC against an audit firm.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Reliance to launch British sandwich & coffee chain Pret A Manger in India
text: Reliance Industries on Thursday said it will be opening outlets of British sandwich and coffee chain Pret A Manger in India, marking its first foray into the food and beverage retail business. The first outlet would reportedly open in Mumbai before March 2023. Pret A Manger, whose name means "ready to eat" in French, first opened in London in 1986.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Mukesh Ambani resigns as Reliance Jio Director, Akash Ambani named Chairman
text: The board of Reliance Jio on Tuesday approved the appointment of Akash Ambani as the Chairman of the company's board. Meanwhile, the company announced that Mukesh Ambani has resigned as Director effective June 27, 2022. The board has further approved the appointment of Pankaj Mohan Pawar as Reliance Jio's Managing Director for a period of five years.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Which are the most expensive Indian cities for foreign employees?
text: As per American asset management firm Mercer's 2022 Cost of Living global report, Mumbai is the most expensive Indian city for foreign workers. Globally, Mumbai is ranked 127th on the list of the most expensive cities for international employees. Among Indian cities, Mumbai is followed by Delhi (155th), Chennai (177th), Bengaluru (178th), Hyderabad (192nd), Pune (201st) and Kolkata (203rd).
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Salmonella discovered in world's largest chocolate factory in Belgium, production halted
text: Salmonella has been discovered in the world's largest chocolate factory in Belgium's Wieze run by Belgian-Swiss chocolate manufacturer Barry Callebaut. The production has been stopped as a precaution and all products produced after June 25 have been blocked. Quality experts identified lecithin as the source of contamination. Lecithin is an emulsifier used in chocolate production.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Airbnb permanently bans all house parties worldwide
text: Airbnb on Tuesday announced a permanent ban on parties in homes listed on its platform globally. The company said that it has witnessed a sharp drop in reports of unauthorised gatherings after it put a temporary ban on such parties amid COVID-19 in 2020. "The ban has been well received by our Host community," said the company in a statement.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Which states have been named 'Top Achievers' in ease of doing business rankings?
text: Andhra Pradesh, Gujarat, Haryana, Karnataka, Punjab, Tamil Nadu and Telangana have been named as "Top Achievers" in the ease of business rankings released by government. Himachal Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra, Odisha, Uttarakhand and UP have been named as "Achievers" in the Business Reforms Action Plan (BRAP) 2020 report. Kerala, Goa and West Bengal are among the states named "Aspirers".
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: CEO of $68-billion UK-based firm resigns, says 'Just want to sit at beach and do nothing'
text: Andrew Formica, the CEO of London-based Jupiter Fund Management, has announced that he is leaving the $68-billion asset management company that he had joined in 2019. "I just want to go sit at the beach and do nothing...I'm not thinking about anything else," he said. The 51-year-old will leave the position on October 1.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Which goods & services will now become costlier due to changes in GST rates?
text: Government has decided to levy GST on pre-packed food items like curd and lassi. Unpacked items including grains will attract GST at same rate when packed. GST will be levied on fee charged by banks for issue of cheques. Government proposed 5% GST, without ITC, on hospital rooms above ₹5,000/day and 12% GST on hotel rooms priced up to ₹1,000/day.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Cryptocurrencies are a clear danger: RBI Governor
text: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das on Thursday described cryptocurrencies as a "clear danger", adding, "Anything that derives value based on make-believe, without any underlying, is just speculation under a sophisticated name." In the foreword to the 25th issue of the Financial Stability Report (FSR), Das also noted that as the financial system gets increasingly digitalised, cyber risks are growing.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Thanks to Musk's birth, whole world has chance to survive: Ukraine Vice PM
text: Ukraine's Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov took to Twitter to wish Tesla CEO Elon Musk on his birthday, saying, "Dear Elon Musk, happy birthday! Perhaps thanks to your birth, the whole world has a chance to survive." "After our victory, we will join the colonisation of Mars. The people of Ukraine are grateful for your support," he added.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Great boost to Indian startups: Ratan Tata on new T-Hub facility in Hyd
text: Tata Group Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata took to Twitter to say that the new T-Hub facility in Hyderabad's IT corridor will be a "great boost to the Indian startup ecosystem". "Congratulations to the Government of Telangana and Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao," he added.The innovation campus will have a total built-up area of 5,82,689 square feet.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Tesla closes an office in US, fires 200 workers there: Report
text: Tesla has shut its office in San Mateo, California, and laid off roughly 200 employees working on its Autopilot driver-assistant system there, Reuters reported. Most of the workers who were laid off were hourly workers. A fired worker said the employees had earlier been informed that they would move to an office in Palo Alto in stages beginning this month.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: John Visentin, CEO of printer maker Xerox, passes away aged 59
text: Printer maker Xerox Holdings Corporation's CEO John Visentin passed away due to complications from a long illness, the company said. "The Xerox family is profoundly saddened by this untimely event and extends its heartfelt condolences to John's wife, his five daughters and his family," the company added. The company has named President and Chief Operating Officer Steve Bandrowczak Interim CEO.
author: Anisha Joneja

headlines: Canara HSBC Life Insurance launches its new brand identity
text: Canara HSBC OBC Life Insurance is now Canara HSBC Life Insurance. With the new brand identity revolving around #PromisesKaPartner, the company has launched a brand campaign that captures the changed promises and priorities of people with changing times. Reassuring its customers to explore the new promises, its commitment to fulfilling all new and old promises remains the same.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: ₹7,678 crore wiped off Zomato's market value in 2 days after Blinkit deal approval
text: Nearly ₹7,678 crore has been wiped out of the market capitalisation of Zomato in two days after the food delivery startup announced a deal to acquire Blinkit. Zomato shares fell as much as 8.2% on Tuesday, extending losses for a second straight day. On Friday, Zomato's board approved a deal to acquire Blinkit for ₹4,447 crore in an all-stock deal.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: ONGC helicopter makes emergency landing in Arabian Sea, 6 rescued so far
text: An ONGC helicopter carrying nine persons including two pilots made an emergency landing in the Arabian sea near ONGC's Sagar Kiran rig in Mumbai High on Tuesday. In a tweet, ONGC confirmed that six people have been rescued so far and attempts are on to rescue the others. The circumstances that led to the emergency landing are not yet clear.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Shapoorji Pallonji Group Chairman Pallonji Mistry passes away aged 93
text: Shapoorji Pallonji Group Chairman and industrialist Pallonji Mistry passed away on Monday night at his residence in Mumbai, aged 93. He is survived by his four children- two sons Shapoor Mistry and Cyrus Mistry, and two daughters Laila Mistry and Aloo Mistry. One of India's oldest billionaires, he was awarded the Padma Bhushan, the country's third-highest civilian award, in 2016.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Rupee hits an all-time low of 78.57 against US dollar
text: The Indian Rupee fell 20 paise to an all-time low of 78.57 against the US dollar in early trade on Tuesday. On Monday, the rupee slipped 1 paisa to close at a record low of 78.34 against the US dollar despite a rally in the domestic equity markets. It had also witnessed an intra-day low of 78.36 in Monday's session.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: No active talks to acquire Robinhood: FTX cryptocurrency exchange
text: Cryptocurrency exchange FTX has said that there are no active talks to acquire trading platform Robinhood after a report emerged claiming that it was exploring such a deal. It further said, "We are excited about Robinhood's business prospects and potential ways we could partner with them." Shares of Robinhood briefly surged 14% after the report about the prospective deal surfaced.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Soft drinks company Robinsons ends Wimbledon sponsorship after 86 years
text: Robinsons and Wimbledon have ended their sponsorship partnership after 86 years. One of the longest-running deals in the sport after being set up in 1935, Robinsons squash was created by Eric Smedley Hodgson, who handed out the soft drink to the players on his first visit to the tournament. The popularity of the drink moved it into commercial production.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Musk crosses 100 mn followers on Twitter to become 6th most-followed account
